p: For anesthetizing mice, Ketamine hydrochloride (100 mg/kg) I.p and xylazine (10 mg/kg) I.p were used [ 49]. The animals were shaved dorsally with the help of an electric clipper, and an outline was marked around the area of the wound by methylene blue using a circular stainless-steel stencil. The wound of 1cm in width and 0.2 cm depth was created along the markings using a surgical blade, pointed scissors, and toothed forceps [ 50]. Sterile conditions opted for all surgical interventions, and post-operative care was ensured. Animals were treated once daily for 14 days.
